body: I like it.
These changes have been merged into the master branch.  It will be part of the 7.1.0 release.
Changes have been made in 7.0.1 that incorporates and expands upon this idea.
@johnament - Since GitHub is a read-only mirror, can you see a way to close out these pull requests without merging them?
Thank you. Will there be a 7.0.2 before 7.1.0?
@jamesbognar do you have write permission yet?

Yep!  Took about 30 minutes.

http://juneau.apache.org/site/apidocs-8.0.0/overview-summary.html#juneau-svl.SvlVariables
Nice! Thanks
Thanks!

I noticed one issue.  You should call commit() on the Config object to make sure your change gets persisted.  It's similar to a database transaction.  Once you call commit, it triggers registered listeners.

Yeah it is good to persist the configuration to original config file. I will update via a PR 
Thanks

I'm not completely clear on our coding/testing standards, so take these as you will.

The config command doesn't check for too many arguments but just ignores them. 

There are no test cases. Do we usually expect test cases (at least unit tests) for new features?

Hi.. Craig

Thanks for the feedback. Yes additional arguments are ignored. I will update by adding
 "Too many arguments" output as well

I checked about console command unit tests. But it seems there are no tests for existing console commands. So that's why I didn't add tests just for new `ConfigCommand`

Please advice how this can be improved further
too many arguments check added [here](https://github.com/apache/juneau/pull/20)

The command API is currently in its infancy.  I don't see a good way to test them yet.  

I should figure out a way of invoking them programmatically for testing purposes.  Something simple on the Microservice class like:
`public String invokeCommand(String name, Object...args) throws Exception`

Then this can be used from a RestTestcase which automatically takes care of initializing a microservice.  I can add a method to this class for retrieving the microservice:

`public static RestMicroservice getMicroservice();`
Thanks!

Hi Marcelo!  

FYI...I'm a bit swamped today and I might not be able to review this until tomorrow.
Cool.  Thanks!

These changes look fine.  I may have suggestions once I see it in my workspace.

Thanks!

@marcelosv - This is causing a build failure.  Can you take a look when you get a chance?

https://builds.apache.org/blue/organizations/jenkins/Juneau-Java-1.8/detail/Juneau-Java-1.8/1164/pipeline
ok, i Will

This change will allow you to use the @BeanProperty annotation on parameters, but you'll need code for it to actually be used.  Search for references to @BeanConstructor(properties).  You'll see in the BeanMeta class how the properties value is used.
Thanks!
Cool
Thanks!
Build is fixed.  Thanks!
Awesome.  Thanks!

@Akayeshmantha - Thanks for the contribution!  If you're interested in describing your examples, I recommend adding some information to the following file:
/juneau-doc/docs/Topics/14.juneau-examples-core/01.Examples.html

These topic files get generated into the Javadoc overview document:
http://juneau.apache.org/site/apidocs-8.0.0/overview-summary.html#juneau-examples-core

Since it's part of the overview document, you might just provide a link with a one-line description that takes you to the javadoc for your example:
http://juneau.apache.org/site/apidocs-8.0.0/org/apache/juneau/examples/core/json/JsonComplexExample.html

Also, you can link to your source code using a {@source} taglet in your class-level javadoc.
Hi @jamesbognar yes James I will for sure do it.Thank you for merging the PR
Thanks!
Thanks!  This will be live when I regenerate the javadocs later today.
Sure @jamesbognar.So would like to contribute on Spring boot examples.Any one started working on it?

Sure!  But FYI...the Spring Boot integration API might still be in flux.  I just did some significant refactoring in the past two days.  Here's the updated documentation (still working on it):
http://juneau.apache.org/site/apidocs-8.0.0/overview-summary.html#juneau-rest-server-springboot

The documentation (which I'm working on today) will describe how to deploy the REST examples as a Spring Boot application on the Heroku cloud platform.  
https://juneau-example.herokuapp.com/

Also, I'm relatively new to Spring and Spring Boot, so design/implementation suggestions are welcome.
Got it James
@jamesbognar I saw Packaging as WAR files in juneau-examples-rest todo file is this something pending
Thanks!
Thanks!  Sorry that these got missed during a move/merge.
Thanks!

Excellent.  Thanks!

The webpage doc is indeed out of date.  Would you be able to update it?  The file that would need to be updated is /templates/marshall.html in the juneau-website git repo:

https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=juneau-website.git;a=blob;f=templates/marshall.html
Hi @jamesbognar  yes for sure james will do it
Thanks!
Thanks!

@Akayeshmantha - Can you add this command to the other configs as well?

juneau-examples-rest-jetty/examples.cfg
juneau-microservice-jetty-template/my-microservice.cfg
juneau-microservice-springboot-template/src/main/resources/juneau.cfg
Sure @jamesbognar  gimme a minute

@jamesbognar  added.

And I noticed on juneau-microservice-springboot-template/src/main/resources/juneau.cfg the logger settings are also not there shall I add them also James

Oh wait....console commands don't apply to Spring Boot because it's not using the Microservice API.   The same applies for the logging settings.  So only add this command to the jetty template and examples.
got it @jamesbognar  James did that
Thanks @jamesbognar  James
@jamesbognar since am not a committer is it still possible for me to push to juneau-website.Am bit a new to git box thats why.And I did the changes on marshall page samples

The GitHub repo for the website is available here:
https://github.com/apache/juneau-website

Can you do a pull request against it there?
Oh I didnt see that thanks james yes will do

1. @jamesbognar James on Juneau-rest module =>  Juneau-rest-server-jaxrs   Basic provider some serializers like HtmlSerializer,UonSerializer missing and in parsers section JsoParser ,UonParser are missing do we need to add them am talking about below class 

https://github.com/apache/juneau/blob/master/juneau-rest/juneau-rest-server-jaxrs/src/main/java/org/apache/juneau/rest/jaxrs/BasicProvider.java)
Thanks!
Thanks!

We should add HtmlSerializer/UonSerializer/UonParser.  However, JsoParser should be avoided.  It's inherently dangerous since you could in theory parse arbitrary Java objects which could lead to all sorts of security bugs.
Yes true that.I will add rest @jamesbognar. Thank you
@jamesbognar sure james thanks
Thanks!
Awesome!  The OpenAPI support is very new.  Let me know if you have any implementation suggestions.
@jamesbognar  yes James looking at the current spec to get more idea on openApi spec at https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification

@Akayeshmantha - FYI...the current OpenAPI support is based on Swagger 2.0 not OpenAPI 3.0.  Due to lack of time, I decided to stick with Swagger 2.0 and leave OpenAPI 3.0 support for future work.  I'd be happy if you wanted to do some work bringing it up to the latest spec!  I don't know how difficult that will be though.
I like it.
@jamesbognar  that's a great news James will start working on it thanks alot

You're working fast!

This looks good so far.  It looks like you're using the Swagger DTO as a guide which is good since it's likely a subset of OpenAPI.  

I'd like to get 8.0.0 out the door before we pull in these changes, so we have time to develop this.
Thank you James.Yes am referring Swagger DTO as the guide.Will work soon on this.
@jamesbognar James any reason to drop Path Item Object,Path object from dto-swagger.
I didn't implement a Paths object because it could be represented as a Map<String,OperationMap>.  I see no reason why we shouldn't add it though.
Yes true that @jamesbognar.It can be represented with OperationMap.Thank you for the clarification.
@Akayeshmantha - Now that 8.0.0 has been released, we can merge this pull request whenever you think you're ready.
@jamesbognar  sure james am working on it.
Hi @jamesbognar am working on this soon.Btw any idea to participate in gsoc 19 ?
Unlikely.  Although it would be cool to do so, I'm pretty busy as-is.

To be honest @jamesbognar James me and Shalitha thought to work on gsoc internships.So since we have context on juneau we thought it would be good to do it for juneau.If you can let us know two compnents that we can work on.We can do a background research and work on the time taking stuffs like application filling and all 🙂

Awesome!

I've asked the main users of the RDF support if they have any objections.  It seems the changes are relatively minor so I don't envision an issue.
Hi @jamesbognar yes that will be great.
Thanks!
Thanks!

@jamesbognar sorry, I would generally love to help, but I am currently not set up for reviews. (Knee deep in a new project just using Node.) I have no concerns as our RDF usage is still bound to the original Juno in JAF. Using the latest here makes total sense.
Thanks @phaumer !

Great start @robledokari 

LGTM 👍🏾
